New Records: Thanks to his goal, Croatia's 38-year-old captain Luka Modric became the oldest scorer in Euros history.
Key Match Events: Lazio's Mattia Zaccagni equalised in the 98th minute to draw 1-1 against a combative Croatian side.
Gianluigi Donnarumma and Croatia's Dominik Livaković made stunning saves from both Italy and Croatia.
Ferran Torres scored a 13th-minute goal for Spain against Albania.
David Raya made a stoppage-time save from Armando Broja to ensure Spain completed the group stage without conceding a single goal.
Pre-Game Insights: Italy needed a point to progress, while Croatia realistically needed a win to stay in the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Luciano Spalletti's Italian squad will now be playing Switzerland in Berlin on Saturday at 18.00 in the knockout stage opening game.
Albania coach Sylvinho said, ‘We left it all on the pitch. I have no regrets for my players.’
Miscellaneous Highlights: Italy never succeeded in beating Croatia in any major tournament so far.
Spain confirmed their 100% win trend against Albania across all 9 official games played.
Albania didn't record a shot until the 45th minute.
De la Fuente responded by sending on forwards Alvaro Morata and Lamine Yamal off the bench.
Others: The defeat means elimination and last place in Group B, for Albania. It also automatically qualifies France, England and the Netherlands for the next round.
